content: आम्नायः [आ-म्ना-घञ्] {@--1@} ({%a%}) Sacred tradition, sacred texts handed down by tradition or repetition. ({%b%}) Hence, the Veda, Vedas taken collectively (including Brāhmaṇas, Upaniṣads and Āraṇyakas also); अधीती चतुर्ष्वाम्नायेषु <ls>Dk. 120</ls>; आम्नायवचनं सत्यमित्ययं लोकसंग्रहः . आम्नायेभ्यः पुनर्वेदाः प्रसृताः सर्वतोमुखाः .. <ls>Mb.</ls> {@--2@} A sacred text or precept in general; <ls>U. 4.</ls> {@--3@} Traditional usage, family or national customs. {@--4@} Received doctrine. {@--5@} Advice or instruction (in past and present usage). {@--6@} A <ls>Tantra.</ls> {@--7@} A series of families.
